metadata.title: CVE-2020-14422 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Lib/ipaddress.py in Python through 3.8.3 improperly computes hash values inthe IPv4Interface and IPv6Interface classes, which might allow a remoteattacker to cause a denial of service if an application is affected by theperformance of a dictionary containing IPv4Interface or IPv6Interfaceobjects, and this attacker can cause many dictionary entries to be created.This is fixed in: v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1; v3.6.12; v3.7.9; v3.8.4, v3.8.4rc1,v3.8.5, v3.8.6, v3.8.6rc1; v3.9.0, v3.9.0b4, v3.9.0b5, v3.9.0rc1,v3.9.0rc2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.1').
